description: The chart's subtitle. This can be used both to display a subtitle below the main title, and to display random text anywhere in the chart. The subtitle can be updated after chart initialization through the Chart.setTitle method.

children.name: align
children.description: The horizontal alignment of the subtitle. Can be one of "left", "center" and "right".

children.name: floating
children.description: When the subtitle is floating, the plot area will not move to make space for it.

children.name: style
children.description:
CSS styles for the title.

In styled mode, the subtitle style is given in the .highcharts-subtitle class.

children.name: useHTML
children.description: Whether to use HTML to render the text.

children.name: verticalAlign
children.description: The vertical alignment of the title. Can be one of "top", "middle" and "bottom". When middle, the subtitle behaves as floating.

children.name: widthAdjust
children.description: Adjustment made to the subtitle width, normally to reserve space for the exporting burger menu.

children.name: x
children.description: The x position of the subtitle relative to the alignment within chart.spacingLeft and chart.spacingRight.

children.name: y
children.description: The y position of the subtitle relative to the alignment within chart.spacingTop and chart.spacingBottom. By default the subtitle is laid out below the title unless the title is floating.
